title: Feri Urnik Google Calendar Generator
tagline: Convert Wisetime tables into Google Calendar links.
summary: A tool that converts timetable exports from Wisetime into a URL that can be imported into Google Calendar. Built with Next.js and Tailwind to help students keep schedules synced automatically.
highlights: Built a parser for Wisetime tables → converted them into iCal format.
Deployed on Vercel for instant use without installation.
Learned how to handle date/time parsing and integration with external calendar systems.

title: Personal Website (2021)
tagline: My first public personal website, built in plain HTML/CSS/JS.

highlights: Learned basics of static web hosting and domain setup.
Applied responsive design concepts with pure CSS.
Kickstarted my habit of building in public.

title: Personal Website (Current)
tagline: My current minimalist portfolio, blog, and project hub.
summary: A minimalist personal site focused on clarity: blog, projects, and AI-powered assistant. Designed to be functional, fast, and serve as the foundation for my personal RAG-powered LLM.
highlights: Implemented static + dynamic routes for blog and projects.
Integrated Supabase for storage, authentication, and RAG pipeline.
Built foundation for personalized LLM chat with embeddings and vector search.

title: Smart Delivery Box (Capstone Project)
tagline: Team project focused on IoT, mobile, and cloud integration.
summary: Capstone project where I led DevOps and architecture decisions for a smart delivery box system. While not AI-focused, this project taught me about teamwork, designing technical roadmaps, and applying full-stack skills in a complex setting.
highlights: Coordinated between frontend (React), backend (NestJS), and mobile app (Kotlin).
Set up CI/CD pipelines, Dockerized microservices, and deployed on VPS.
Learned project management, new tech adoption, and technical leadership.
